official-title.#text:
To improve the response to and prevention of sexual
		  assaults involving members of the Armed Forces.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Review and policy regarding
			 Department of Defense investigative practices in response to allegations of
			 sex-related offenses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a review of
			 the practices of the military criminal investigative organizations (Army
			 Criminal Investigation Command, Naval Criminal Investigative Service, and Air
			 Force Office of Special Investigation) regarding the investigation of alleged
			 sex-related offenses involving members of the Armed Forces, including the
			 extent to which the military criminal investigative organizations make a
			 recommendation regarding whether an allegation of a sex-related offense appears
			 founded or unfounded.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of
			 the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop a uniform policy for the
			 Armed Forces, to the extent practicable, regarding the use of case
			 determinations to record the results of the investigation of a sex-related
			 offense. In developing the policy, the

shall consider the feasibility
			 of adopting case determination methods, such as the uniform crime report, used
			 by nonmilitary law enforcement agencies.

text.#text: After conducting the review required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(article 120, 120a, 120b,
			 120c, or 125 of the Uniform Code of Military Justice); or

(article 80 of
			 the Uniform Code of Military Justice).

text.#text:
an attempt to commit an offense specified
			 in a paragraph (1) as punishable under

header.#text:
Development of
			 selection criteria for assignment as Sexual Assault Response and Prevention
			 Program Managers, Sexual Assault Response Coordinators, and Sexual Assault
			 Victim Advocates

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to be
				selected for assignment to duty as a Sexual Assault Response and Prevention
				Program Manager, Sexual Assault Response Coordinator, or Sexual Assault Victim
				Advocate, whether assigned to such duty on a full-time or part-time
				basis;

text.#text:
the qualifications necessary for a member
				of the Armed Forces or a civilian employee of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the training, certification, and status of
				members of the Armed Forces and civilian employees of the department assigned
				to duty as Sexual Assault Response and Prevention Program Managers, Sexual
				Assault Response Coordinators, and Sexual Assault Victim Advocates for the
				Armed Forces;

header.#text:
Uniform training
			 and education programs for sexual assault prevention and response
			 program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:585/ss:a/p:1

quote.#text:
Not later than one year after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, the Secretary of each military department shall develop
			 a curriculum to provide sexual assault prevention and response training and
			 education for members of the Armed Forces under the jurisdiction of the
			 Secretary and civilian employees of the military department

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 develop a uniform curriculum to provide sexual assault prevention and response
			 training and education for members of the Armed Forces and civilian employees
			 of the
